page.title: 19Fenland wildlife
page.content: The flat open areas of the fens may at first appear to be inhospitable places with their carefully laid out fields and long straight roads. However this is far from the case the whole area abounds with wildlife and fauna. The ditches and dykes are refuge places for some of our rarest plants and butterflies alongside the common rushes and reeds. The drains attract large numbers of migrating birds including canada and greylag geese, pintail and mallard duck, and bewick swans. In the water fish live in great numbers, tench, carp, rudd, bream, perch, pike, eels and a newcomer caus- ing some distress zander. Occasionally otters can be seen and some wild mink. Rabbits and hares are common as are foxes although badgers are sadly scarce.
